definition: to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The competent authorities shall impose necessary administrative and disciplinary sanctions on those who have violated the aforesaid provisions.
sentences.chinese: 違反者，主管部門應給予必要的行政或紀律處分。

sentences.english: The obligee's ratification of unauthorized disposition can validate the disposition behavior.
sentences.chinese: 權利人對無權處分的追認可以使處分行爲有效。

sentences.english: The obligee's ratification of unauthorized disposition can validate the disposition behavior.
sentences.chinese: 權利人對無權處分的追認可以使處分行爲有效。

sentences.english: The police rank of any traffic policeman who is imposed upon an administrative sanction below removal from post shall be degraded.
sentences.chinese: 受到撤職以下行政處分的交通警察，應當降低警銜。

sentences.english: Any member of the Macao Garrison who breaches military discipline shall be subject to disciplinary sanction.
sentences.chinese: 澳門駐軍人員違反軍隊紀律的，給予紀律處分。

sentences.english: He was degraded for being drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他因酗酒而受到降級處分。

sentences.english: if the case is not serious for criminal punishments, they shall be given administrative sanctions in accordance with law.
sentences.chinese: 尚不夠刑事處罰的，依法給予行政處分。

sentences.english: The deputy police commissioner yesterday promised to discipline officers found to be slack on duty.
sentences.chinese: 警務處副處長答應會對“蛇王”的警員紀律處分。

sentences.english: He was degraded from office for his dereliction of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他因瀆職而受到降級處分。

sentences.english: Part five, The protective measures of law in operation of China.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分，我國現行法上的保安處分性質措施。

sentences.english: He had been punished for covering up for a friend.
sentences.chinese: 他因包庇友人曾受到處分。

sentences.english: Should be given disciplinary action by the discipline inspection and supervision departments.
sentences.chinese: 應當給予紀律處分的，由紀檢監察部門處理。

sentences.english: those who violate traffic regulations should be punished.
sentences.chinese: 違背交通規矩的人應該受到處分。

sentences.english: The student handbook says that students will face disciplinary action if caught.
sentences.chinese: 學生手冊稱被抓到的學生將會面臨紀律處分。

sentences.english: The second part introduces the history of the right of disposition.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分介紹了處分權的歷史沿革。

sentences.english: Expulsion is the ultimate Party disciplinary measure.
sentences.chinese: 開除黨籍是黨內的最高處分。

definition: lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
